content.question: In two common species of flowers, A and B, the proportions of flowers that are blue are <math alttext="p sub a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="p sub b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> , respectively. Suppose that independent random samples of 50 species-A flowers and 100 species-B flowers are selected. Let <math alttext="p hat sub a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> be the sample proportion of blue species-A flowers and <math alttext="p hat sub b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> be the sample proportion of blue species-B flowers. What is the mean of the sampling distribution of <math alttext="p hat sub a minus p hat sub b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="p sub a minus p sub b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction p sub a over 50, end fraction, minus the fraction p sub b over 100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="p hat sub a minus p hat sub b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="The fraction with numerator p sub a times, open parenthesis, 1 minus p sub a, close parenthesis, and denominator 50, end fraction, plus, the fraction with numerator p sub b times, open parenthesis, 1 minus p sub b, close parenthesis and denominator 100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="The square root of the fraction with numerator p sub a times, open parenthesis, 1 minus p sub a, close parenthesis, and denominator 50, end fraction, plus, the fraction with numerator p sub b times, open parenthesis, 1 minus p sub b, close parenthesis and denominator 100, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="p sub a minus p sub b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 5.6: Sampling Distributions for Differences in Sample Proportions

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
